sentence.Network_en: They have won over 100 rosettes together in dressage competitions up and down Britain.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们已经在英国各地的花式骑术比赛中赢得了100多枚玫瑰花形奖章。

sentence.Network_en: For the first time, all the medalists in dressage were women.
sentence.Network_cn: 所有马术的奖牌获得者首次都是女性.

sentence.Network_en: The growth in popularity of international dressage has been dynamic.
sentence.Network_cn: 国际盛装舞步的受欢迎程度一直以来有增无减.

derivation.yuyuan_name: 1930s: from French, literally training', from dresser 'to train'

entry.def: Dressage is a competition in which horse riders have to make their horse perform controlled movements.

means.word_mean: 1. maneuvers of a horse in response to body signals by the rider
